alert.note: Alert for Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 23 at 2:01PM CDT until April 26 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Hidalgo. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 201 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mission, Pharr, San Juan, Alamo, Hidalgo, Palmview, Penitas, La Joya, Palmhurst, Sharyland, South McAllen, Lloyd & Dolly Bentsen Elementary School, Brown Middle School, Sharyland High School, Mission Fire Station Number 3, Mcallen Convention Center, Mission Regional Medical Center, Airport Park, B.l. Gray Junior High School and Castro Elementary School. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
